para: VLS can stream MPEG files that meet two critera

listitem.para: the file must be MPEG PS (Program Stream) or MPEG TS (Transport Stream), that contain video and audio multiplexed. VLS cannot stream MPEG ES (Elementary Stream), i.e. a file with only audio or video .
In order to know if an MPEG file is MPEG PS, MPEG TS or MPEG ES, read the file with VLC and look at the messages (in the messageswindow or use the command line vlc -vvv) .

listitem.programlisting: [00000107] main module debug: using demux module "ts_dvbpsi"
listitem.para: it means the file is MPEG TS .

listitem.programlisting: [00000109] main module debug: using demux module "ps"
listitem.para: it means the file is MPEG PS .

listitem.programlisting: [00000109] main module debug: using demux module "es"
listitem.para: it means the file is MPEG ES, VLS can't stream it .

the sequence header of the video must repeat itself regularly, which is often the case with MPEG-2, but very rare with MPEG-1. There is no easy way to know if the sequence header is repeated regularly. Files with a .vob extension are normally MPEG-2 files and files with .mpg or .mpeg extension are usually MPEG-1 files .
